title: Haryana Human Rights Commission raps Hansi authorities for slacking in sewer deaths probe
content: The HHRC had taken a suo motu cognisance of the deaths of two workers in Hansi in Haryana, who allegedly died after being forced to enter a hotel's septic tank without protective gear

title: Jawan killed as fire breaks out in BSF camp building in J&K
content: The deceased jawan was identified as Constable Ramesh Kumar, who was working as a washerman, says the officials

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan leads LDF’s protest against Central policies, calls it ‘fight for survival’
content: Accusing the Centre of adopting a ‘biased and vengeful attitude’ towards Kerala, CM says State is demanding only what is Constitutionally eligible

title: Jana Nayagan production house moves Supreme Court
content: The production house has arraigned the Central Board of Film Certification and its Regional Officer as respondents in the case before the Supreme Court

title: Two shooters, five others arrested in Punjab for AAP sarpanch murder case
content: “The other five arrested accused, who were part of the support and logistical module, were arrested from Punjab,” the DGP Singh

title: Air India flight diverted to Jaipur due to medical emergency
content: The source said an elderly passenger became unwell onboard the flight AI2517, following which the flight was diverted to Jaipur, where the passenger was deboarded and taken to hospital.

title: Mumbai BMC elections 2026: Full schedule, voting time and results
content: The State Election Commission (SEC) announced that the elections for 29 municipal corporations in Maharashtra, including the BMC, will be held in a single phase on January 15, 2026.

title: At 145, Mizoram recorded six-year high TB deaths in 2025
content: “Of the 2,275 new cases, 1,900 were detected in government facilities, while the remaining 375 cases were found in private centres,” says official data

title: Inter-State cyber fraud racket busted; people from Bihar, Kerala, Odisha arrested
content: Acting on a tip-off, officers raided a house in the Badagada police station area of Bhubaneswar, Odisha

title: Patna High Court goes hard on Bihar police over unlawful arrest of a minor student
content: In the habeas corpus case plea, Justice Rajeev Ranjan Prasad and Ritesh Kumar gave the judgment and directed the state to pay a compensation of ₹5 lakh to the 15 year old boy

title: Websol to set up an 8 GW integrated solar manufacturing complex at Naidupeta
content: The government has also allotted 300 acres to the company for setting up a captive solar power plant, enabling it to run its manufacturing facility on renewable, self-generated power

title: Realty sector seeks revision of affordable housing price cap ahead of Budget 2026
content: Industry bodies highlight that escalating land acquisition costs and construction overheads have rendered the current tax thresholds obsolete, particularly in rapidly expanding urban corridors

title: West Bengal SIR: ECI signals action after official questions process in public
content: On January 8, 2026, Assistant Electoral Registration Officer Mousam Sarkar wrote to the Electoral Registration Officer of Bagnan, alleging logical discrepancies in the AERO log and resigned from the post of AERO

title: What does two PSLV mission failures in a row mean for ISRO? | Analysis
content: ISRO is aggressively pushing the PSLV as a commercial product; the rocket’s PS3 stage is a solid fuel motor and a technologically mature component; it shouldn’t fail, yet it has failed to perform as expected in two successive missions

title: Karnataka Excise Minister directs officials to prevent production of illicit liquor, hooch in Yadgir district
content: Minister R.B. Timmapur has directed officials to take stern action against persons involved in selling CH powder for use in making illicit liquor

title: Probe launched after ‘drone’ sighted over Kannur Central Jail in Kerala
content: According to the FIR, a drone-like object was seen flying near cattle shed of the jail between 4.20 pm and 4.30 pm on Saturday. The object later moved towards the women’s jail section

title: We agreed on friendly fights, but Ajit Pawar’s restraint appears shaken: Devendra Fadnavis
content: Ajit Pawar won’t “speak” after January 15, 2026, when votes will be cast, said Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis, exuding confidence in the BJP's performance

title: Indian High Commission hosts Pongal festivities for migrant workers in Singapore
content: “Over 50 talented local artists, performing alongside migrant workers, delivered electrifying performances and colourful cultural showcases that captured the essence and vibrancy of India’s harvest festivals,” says lead organiser of Mett.AI

title: BJP assassinated Mahatma Gandhi for second time by changing MGNREGA name, says Karnataka Minister Shivraj Tangadagi
content: The Minister alleged that the BJP was acting under pressure from the RSS and was driven by a ‘Manusmriti mindset’ that was hostile to Dalits, women and marginalised communities

title: We will change landscape of Kalaburagi in the next two-and-a-half years, says Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge
content: The Minister laid the foundation stone for civic work worth ₹108.82 crore under various schemes of the Kalaburagi City Corporation

title: PSLV-C62/EOS-N1 Mission encounters anomaly during end of PS3 stage
content: After a 22.5-hour countdown, the PSLV-C62 with the EOS-N1 satellite and 15 co-passenger satellites developed by startups and academia from India and abroad lifted off from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota at 10.18 a.m

title: Prabuddha Academy launched in Kalaburagi to provide quality competitive exam coaching in Kalyana Karnataka
content: Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister Priyank Kharge suggested that IAS and IPS officers from the region volunteer to teach aspirants at the academy

title: Repeated disruptions of peaceful Sikh nagar kirtans in New Zealand deeply concerning: Sukhbir Badal
content: Before the latest incident, last month, Mr. Badal had urged the Centre to take up the issue of "disruption" of a peaceful nagar kirtan procession in south Auckland by local protesters with the government of New Zealand

title: Bandh in Assam’s Kokrajhar over mentally-challenged woman’s rape; accused injured in police firing
content: The rape happened in the Patharghat area of the district on January 10, with the accused apprehended within a few hours

title: T.P. Chandrasekharan murder case: First accused granted parole
content: Prison authorities say parole granted to convict Anoop is a ‘routine, natural’ one in accordance with rules

title: German Chancellor in India LIVE: Close cooperation between two economies important for humanity, says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the International Kite Festival-2026 and later enjoyed kite flying with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz

title: Should the age of consent be lowered?
content: While some argue that the current law criminalises consensual relationships among adolescents, others warn that lowering the age could undermine protections against child exploitation. This debate comes amid rising POCSO cases, highlighting a growing conflict between adolescent autonomy and the need to safeguard vulnerable minors

title: Congress slams 'trouble-engine' U.P. govt. for 'brutal lathi-charge' on MGNREGA Bachao protesters
content: The Congress agitation demanding the withdrawal of the VB-G RAM G Act and restoration of MGNREGA as a rights-based law in its original form, the right to work, and the authority of panchayats will continue till February 25

title: Will speak after 100 days on new government: Opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav returns to Patna, pledges to monitor the new government’s performance after 100 days of its formation

title: Former chief of Naval staff Arun Prakash asked to establish identity under SIR
content: Collector of South Goa Egna Cleetus said that she will go through the Navy veteran’s enumeration form and the authorities will reach out to him

title: NRI doctor-YouTuber Sangram Patil detained at Mumbai airport over defamation case
content: The BJP functionary, who filed the complaint, has alleged that Dr. Patil spread false information about the ruling party and made derogatory remarks against its leaders

title: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz arrives in Ahmedabad, on his first official visit to India
content: PM Modi will meet Friedrich Merz today in Ahmedabad. This will be Mr. Merz’s first official visit to India

title: City residents feel the chill as temperature drops
content: The Regional Meteorological Centre forecast light to moderate rain for Monday at a few places over Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal

title: 10 people arrested in connection with communal violence in Tripura's Unakoti
content: Police said no fresh violence has been reported, with paramilitary forces conducting foot patrolling in the sensitive areas

title: Use of state power against Opposition shrinks democratic space, says Ashwani Kumar
content: Former Union Minister says there is a “discernible drift today towards a muscular state at the expense of a constitutional one”

title: Hemant Soren cherishes memories of late Shibu Soren on  82nd birth anniversary
content: Remembering his father who passed away last year on August 4, Mr. Soren said that though he is not present but his contribution, sacrifice, dedication and his thoughts were still alive today.

title: Indore water contamination deaths: Blindspotting in India’s cleanest city
content: Contaminated drinking water, supplied through government-laid pipelines, led to a diarrhoea outbreak in Indore, killing at least 8 and affecting about 3,000 people. Mehul Malpani reports on unplanned parts of one of Madhya Pradesh’s most promising cities, the delays in laying pipelines, and the blame game that follows when deaths get international coverage

title: Suspected Pakistan drones seen hovering over areas along LoC, IB; search ops launched in three J&K districts
content: All the flying objects came from the Pakistan side, and returned after hovering over Indian territory for few minutes,  officials said

title: Won’t let BJP and Adani take away Mumbai, say Thackeray cousins
content: They accuse the party of pursuing divisive politics and systematically ‘isolating’ Mumbai’s Marathi Manoos; the cousins claim the national party has been facilitating land grab to benefit Adani Group and conspiring to ‘separate Mumbai from Maharashtra and bring it closer to Gujarat”

title: 484 electors from Kolkata’s Chinese community deleted during SIR: study
content: A majority of the deleted voters, 389 out of 484, have been categorised as untraceable or absent; the three assembly constituencies that were analysed by the researchers of Sabar Institute are Kasba, Entally and Chowrangee

title: Telangana Man, 80, Who Built His Own Grave Dies, Laid To Rest
content: An 80-year-old man in Telangana, who built his own grave while leading a healthy life, passed away on January 11.

title: "Trump May Visit Next Year": US Says No Country More Essential Than India
content: No other nation is as essential to the United States as India, said US ambassador-designate Sergio Gor, as he announced that Washington and New Delhi are set to restart their next round of trade deal talks from Tuesday (January 12).

title: Indian Army Officer Wins UN Award For Gender-Inclusive Peacekeeping
content: Major Swathi Shantha Kumar, an Indian Army officer from Bengaluru currently serving with the UN Mission in South Sudan, has been awarded the prestigious UN Secretary-Generals Award 2025 for her contribution to gender-inclusive peacekeeping

title: Walmart CEO, Who Is Set To Retire, Earns Rs 1.4 Lakh Every 30 Minutes
content: When Doug McMillon started working at Walmart in 1984, he earned $6.50 per hour (about Rs 585) unloading trailers in the company's warehouses.

title: No VIP Quota, Local Cuisine: Inside India's First Vande Bharat Sleeper Train
content: According to official sources, the Vande Bharat Sleeper train - India's first - will be for the general public and VIP or emergency quota will not be allowed.

title: Air India Flight Diverted To Jaipur Due To Medical Emergency
content: An Air India flight from the national capital to Vijayawada was diverted to Jaipur due to a medical emergency on Monday morning, according to a source.

title: Air Strike To Starlink Support: What Are Trump's Iran Options?
content: US President Donald Trump has said that the United States is closely monitoring the unrest in Iran and is mulling "potential options" as the Islamic Republic faces its third week of nationwide protests against the theocratic regime led by Khamenei.

title: "Shameless, Illegal And Immoral": North Korea Slams US At UN
content: North Korea condemned on Monday what it called "shameless" moves by the United States that it said undermined the United Nations and accused Washington of a "hideous criminal act".

title: "Wrongful Restriction": Probe Agency ED Slams Mamata Banerjee Over I-PAC Raids
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED), in a petition in the Supreme Court, flagged the "wrongful restriction" of its officers during raids at the I-PAC office in Kolkata.

title: Centre Junks Report On Forcing Smartphone Manufacturers To Share Source Code
content: The Union IT Ministry has refuted a Reuters report which claimed that the government is proposing to force smartphone manufacturers to share source code and make several software changes as part of a raft of security measures.

title: At 145, Mizoram Recorded Six-Year High Tuberculosis Deaths In 2025
content: A total of 145 people have died of tuberculosis (TB) in Mizoram in 2025, the highest fatalities in six years, according to official data.

title: German Chancellor In India LIVE: PM Modi Holds Bilateral Talks With Merz, India Germany Sign Pact
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz's India Tour LIVE: Merz's visit from Monday -- his first to an Asian country since he took office last May -- comes two weeks ahead of a planned EU-India summit.

title: Video: PM Modi, German Chancellor Merz Fly Kite At Sabarmati Riverfront
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday inaugurated the International Kite Festival-2026 at Sabarmati Riverfront in Ahmedabad and later enjoyed kite flying with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz.

title: "We'll Stay With Mahayuti": NCP's Praful Patel Amid Tie-Up With Sharad Pawar
content: Two rival NCP factions, led by Ajit Pawar and Sharad Pawar, have formed an alliance for the municipal elections in Pune, Pimpri-Chinchwad, and Parbhani.

title: From Karate To Kenjutsu Master: Pawan Kalyan's Martial Arts Journey
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan has been inducted into Kenjutsu, the ancient Japanese art of swordsmanship. The actor-politician was also awarded the Fifth Dan (5th Dan) by the Sogo Budo Kanri Kai

title: Bengaluru Men Use AI To Pose As Woman On Dating App, Extort Rs 1.5 Lakh
content: Fraudsters allegedly used artificial intelligence to pose as a young woman on a dating app and extorted more than Rs 1.5 lakh from a 26-year-old man in Bengaluru.

title: US Cop Wounded In 'Ambush-Style' Attack, Suspect Killed In Shootout
content: A South Carolina police officer was shot and wounded while sitting in his patrol car Sunday in what one official called an "ambush-style attack," and local sheriff's deputies later shot and killed a suspect in a shootout, authorities said.

title: PM Modi's New Office Near Raisina Hill Ready, He May Shift This Month
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's new office near Raisina Hill is almost ready. Workers are now giving the finishing touches, and the Prime Minister is likely to start working from the new office later this month.

title: TVK Chief Vijay Appears Before CBI In Karur Stampede Case
content: The stampede occurred on September 27 last year at a massive political rally addressed by Vijay, marking one of the deadliest crowd disasters in Tamil Nadu's recent political history.

title: 'Ram' Listed Option To Dog's Name Query In Chhattisgarh Exam Paper, Head Staff Suspended
content: The question paper, used in government schools across several districts of the Raipur division, asked, "What is Mona's dog's name?" The four options were Bala, Sheru, Ram, and none of the above.

title: I-PAC raids: ED makes big charge against Mamata in SC; accuses CM of destroying evidence
content: The Enforcement Directorate has approached the Supreme Court. It seeks an FIR against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, the DGP, and the Kolkata Police Commissioner. The agency alleges obstruction and evidence tampering in a money laundering case. This involves a probe into the political consultancy firm I-PAC. The ED claims its officers were threatened and evidence was seized.

title: IND vs NZ: Chase Kings! India first team to hunt down 300-plus targets 20 times in ODIs
content: India achieved a historic four-wicket victory over New Zealand in the first ODI, successfully chasing down a target of 301. This win marked their 20th successful pursuit of 300-plus totals in ODIs, a world record. Virat Kohli's 93 anchored the chase, with crucial late contributions from Harshit Rana and KL Rahul sealing the win.

title: CEO of Canada's biggest tech co: Officials seeking X ban must resign; calls it 'great honeypot'
content: Shopify CEO Tobi Lutke labeled reports of a potential ban on X and Grok by the UK, Canada, and Australia as a "great honeypot," suggesting officials proposing such measures should resign. While Canada has denied considering a ban, the UK is reportedly contemplating it, with Indonesia and Malaysia already restricting Grok access due to concerns over explicit content.

title: It’s a first! Budget 2026 to be presented on a Sunday; Om Birla confirms date
content: Marking a historic first, the Union Budget for 2026 will be presented on Sunday, February 1st. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla confirmed the date, with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman set to table the budget for the eighth time. The Budget Session, commencing January 28th, will see this significant financial announcement on a weekend.

title: Trump tariffs: Sergio Gor says India-US deal decision due tomorrow
content: India-US trade deal: US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor said trade deal talks are ongoing, with both sides actively engaged and the next discussion scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Microsoft's $7.5 billion problem: GitHub losing developers; Nadella forces overhaul
content: Microsoft is on a mission to reinvent GitHub as a leading hub for AI development, directly challenging emerging competitors like Cursor and Claude Code. With a noticeable dip in developer engagement, the tech giant is fusing AI tools into its operations and reshaping its organizational structure.

title: Two World C'ships: 'It's so complex' – Can Total Chess Tour shrug off 'copycat' tag?
content: Elite chess is experiencing a surge of "World Championships" with two major announcements: the Total Chess World Championship Tour and the FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship. Both promise global reach and significant prize money, leading to comparisons and player confusion. The execution of these ambitious tours will determine their success and impact on the chess landscape.

title: SC plea on censor certificate: Makers challenge Madras HC stay; release fate uncertain
content: Thalapathy Vijay's final film, 'Jana Nayagan,' faces release delays due to a censorship dispute. Makers have approached the Supreme Court after the Madras High Court overturned a previous order allowing certification. This legal battle, involving senior lawyers, aims for a swift resolution to ensure the film hits theaters soon, a highly anticipated event for fans.

title: Your heart doesn’t care how young you are: Myths busted by cardiologists
content: Heart disease is a silent killer, affecting younger individuals due to modern lifestyles and prevalent myths. Cardiologists urge people to disregard misconceptions like 'too young' or 'no chest pain' as warning signs are often subtle. Ignoring these can lead to delayed treatment and dire consequences, emphasizing the critical need for early detection and proactive health management.

title: Maha local body polls: Will NCP factions come together? Ajit Pawar, Sule don’t rule it out
content: Speculation of a permanent merger between the two NCP factions is growing after Ajit Pawar and Supriya Sule hinted at a possible reunion. Both leaders stated that the current alliance is for upcoming local body elections, with decisions on a permanent merger to be made later. This comes amid apparent cracks within the ruling Mahayuti alliance.

title: Stock market today: Which are the top 10 losers and gainers on NSE, BSE?
content: Dalal Street indices, NSE Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, experienced a dip on Monday due to weak investor sentiment, foreign fund outflows, and geopolitical concerns. Despite an initial decline, the indices later recovered. Market sentiment remained strained by significant foreign institutional investor sales on Friday.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle confirms delay in Sports Club Atelier collection
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, shared an update on her upcoming collaboration with Hockey Canada, confirming a slight delay in the launch. She emphasized the importance of getting every detail right. The collection follows the success of her earlier releases, which blend hockey culture with luxury streetwear.

title: Vanessa Bryant thanks fans for braving rain at emotional Mamba book signing
content: Vanessa Bryant recently hosted a 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever' book signing, drawing large crowds despite rain. The event celebrated Kobe and Gianna Bryant's enduring legacy through art and community. Fans shared personal stories, highlighting how Vanessa's foundation continues to inspire and provide sports opportunities for underserved youth, honoring her family's memory.

title: Ayesha Curry promotes Jamaican tourism after devastating hurricane
content: Ayesha Curry is urging fans to support Jamaica's recovery from Hurricane Melissa by visiting the island. She highlighted that tourism is crucial for the Jamaican economy, with nearly 30% of the workforce dependent on it. Curry emphasized that a vacation serves as a donation, with airports and most hotels now operational.

title: Scientists develop injection to turn tumor immune cells into cancer fighters
content: Scientists have developed a novel therapy that converts existing immune cells within tumors into potent anticancer fighters. This innovative approach utilizes CAR-macrophages, which are adept at infiltrating dense tumors and signaling other immune cells to join the fight. Early clinical trials show promise for treating solid cancers with fewer side effects.

title: Malayalam Language Bill 2025: What happens when language laws enter schools
content: The Malayalam Language Bill 2025 has triggered an inter-state dispute not over identity, but over schooling. By making Malayalam compulsory as a first language in Classes 1–10, the law raises questions about how safeguards for linguistic minorities will work in border districts like Kasaragod. The debate turns on a familiar fault line: Where language promotion ends, and classroom compulsion begins.

title: ‘We will hit them at levels …’: Trump reacts to Iran’s threat to target US military bases
content: US President Donald Trump stated Washington is monitoring Iran's deadly protests and considering military retaliation, warning of unprecedented strikes if attacked. Iran's President accused the US and Israel of fomenting unrest, while the UN urged an end to the violent crackdown and restoration of internet access. Activists report over 544 deaths and thousands detained amid escalating violence.

title: 'No delivery is worth a life': Swiggy agent falls from moving train while delivering food; company responds
content: A Swiggy delivery partner narrowly escaped serious injury after falling from the Prashanti Express at Anantapur railway station. The incident occurred when the train began moving before the agent could safely exit after delivering food. This has raised concerns about gig worker safety during short-halt train deliveries.

title: Washington Sundar ruled out of ODI series due to injury
content: India faces a significant setback as all-rounder Washington Sundar is ruled out of the remaining ODIs against New Zealand due to a side strain. This injury casts doubt on his availability for the upcoming T20 series, adding to team concerns ahead of the T20 World Cup. The BCCI is expected to announce his replacement shortly.

title: Saif Ali Khan’s 16 acre land safe: Bhopal court upholds Pataudi family's ownership
content: A Bhopal court has dismissed a civil suit challenging the ownership of a 16.62-acre land parcel, ruling in favor of Saif Ali Khan, Sharmila Tagore, and other legal heirs of the royal family.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 trades below 25,500; Sensex down over 600 points
content: Indian stock benchmarks Nifty50 and Sensex opened lower on Monday, extending their decline for a fifth consecutive session. Investor sentiment was impacted by global trade concerns and political uncertainty. Meanwhile, Asian equities saw gains, building on a strong start to the year for global stocks.

title: Gold price prediction: Why are prices rallying & what's the next level to watch out?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are rallying this week, says Manav Modi of Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd. But what's the outlook for the coming week and what will be the key triggers? We take a look:

title: 'I'll kick you': Raj Thackeray warns UP, Bihar migrants against Hindi imposition
content: Calling the BMC polls the "last election for the Marathi man", Thackeray said: "If you miss this opportunity today, you will be finished. Unite for Marathi and Maharashtra."​​ Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray and his cousin Raj Thackeray on Sunday mounted a joint attack on the rival BJP over what they described as “fake Hindutva” at a rally held ahead of the civic polls.

title: Hidden drama in Team India's chase: KL Rahul says 'I didn't know ... '
content: KL Rahul revealed the significant challenge of managing India's run chase when Washington Sundar was unable to run effectively due to a back issue. Rahul had to balance aggression with caution, focusing on strike rotation and preventing dot balls to secure the win. His composure and strategic management proved crucial in the tense finish.

title: Karur stampede probe: Vijay appears before CBI; agency grills TVK chief over tragedy
content: Actor and TVK Chief Vijay appeared before the CBI in Delhi for questioning regarding the Karur stampede case. The investigation, now with the CBI following a Supreme Court order, concerns a tragic incident last September that resulted in 41 deaths and over 60 injuries during a political meeting.

title: Watch: PM Modi kicks off International Kite Festival; shares kite-flying moment with German Chancellor
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz arrived in Ahmedabad for his first official visit to India, joining Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the International Kite Festival. The leaders also paid respects at Sabarmati Ashram. Discussions are set to focus on strengthening bilateral cooperation across various sectors, including trade, technology, and defense, building on the 25-year-old strategic partnership.

title: The great pacific garbage patch is becoming home to some of the aquatic species
content: Scientists have discovered that plastic waste in the Pacific Ocean is now home to marine life. Coastal animals are unexpectedly surviving and even reproducing on floating debris. This new community, formed on plastic rafts, is altering ocean ecosystems. The findings reveal the high seas are not as empty as previously believed, being reshaped by human waste.

title: Is the era of salaried jobs ending? Here’s what expert advise students
content: India's white-collar job growth has slowed significantly.  Experts warn that automation and AI are transforming employment.  Students must develop skills that machines cannot replicate, such as creativity and problem-solving.  Adaptability and continuous learning are crucial for future career success.  Those who embrace these changes will thrive in the evolving job market.

title: Inside Hrithik’s yacht birthday with Saba, Sussanne, sons
content: Hrithik Roshan marked his 52nd birthday with an intimate celebration surrounded by family and close friends, and later took to social media to express his gratitude to everyone who showered him with love. While birthday wishes poured in from fans, colleagues and loved ones, the actor was away celebrating on a yacht, soaking in the moment with those closest to him.

title: India, SL or Pak? ICC–BCB impasse deepens as B'desh venues remain unresolved
content: Bangladesh's T20 World Cup venue remains uncertain as the BCB seeks a shift to Sri Lanka due to security concerns. The ICC and BCCI are exploring Indian alternatives like Chennai and Thiruvananthapuram. This impasse follows a dispute over a player's IPL release, escalating tensions and impacting broadcast rights. Pakistan has also offered to host.

title: Hinduism vs Hindutva: Mani Shankar Aiyar draws distinction, triggers row; BJP hits back
content: Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar stated that Hindutva is "Hinduism in paranoia," arguing it incites fear among Hindus towards Muslims. He contrasted this with Hinduism, calling it a spiritual religion that has thrived for millennia without Hindutva's protection. BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi countered that Hindutva represents the core essence of Hinduism, or 'Hindu tattva,' and cherishing Hinduism is Hindutva.

title: Swami Vivekananda's birth anniversary: Will banks remain shut on January 12?
content: Banks will observe multiple holidays in January 2026, including regional festivals and national observances.  Key closures include Swami Vivekananda's birth anniversary on January 12 in West Bengal and Republic Day nationwide on January 26. Customers should plan financial activities accordingly, as only digital services will be available on these days.

title: Rupee continues the plunge: Currency falls 5 paise to 90.23 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee opened lower against the US dollar, impacted by rising crude oil prices and foreign investor outflows. Geopolitical tensions and potential US tariffs are prompting a sell-off in domestic equities. Investors are now awaiting key economic data for market direction, as global crude prices and domestic stock markets also saw a dip.

title: Trump's big claim: 50 million barrels of Venezuela oil ‘on its way to US’
content: President Trump announced that the U.S. is working "along really well" with Venezuela, highlighting a deal for 50 million barrels of oil. This move is part of an effort to gain control over Venezuelan oil production and sales, with the administration encouraging private investment and offering security assurances to oil executives.

title: Bengaluru: Student kills techie for rejecting advances; sets flat ablaze to mask crime
content: A Bengaluru software engineer's death, initially thought to be from a house fire, has been reclassified as murder. A second-year pre-university student was arrested for allegedly smothering the woman after she resisted his advances and then setting her flat ablaze to conceal the crime.

title: 'Incumbent January 2026': Trump posts fake image; calls himself 'Acting President of Venezuela'
content: Donald Trump shared a doctored Wikipedia image showing him as "Acting President of Venezuela" with JD Vance as deputy, effective January 2025. This follows the US-led capture of former Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, who faces drug trafficking charges in New York. Delcy Rodríguez has been sworn in as Venezuela's interim president.

title: 'My mum keeps all my trophies': Virat Kohli
content: Virat Kohli described his career as a dream come true after becoming the fastest batter to 28,000 international runs. He expressed immense gratitude for his journey, emphasising his joy in bringing happiness to fans through cricket. Kohli also shared his aggressive batting mindset and revealed his trophies are sent to his mother.

title: ‘Superstar’ Krishna’s bond with Vijayawada cast in bronze at Lenin Centre
content: Vijayawada MP recalls the veteran actor’s deep bond with the city as a bronze statue portraying his Ram Raju role from Eenadu is unveiled

title: Environment Ministry funds sought for forest management committees
content: Move necessary to ‘correct the perception’ that the forest bureaucracy was at odds with the goals of community-led forest resource management, officials say

title: Right time to buy immovable property in Andhra Pradesh, says RERA chairman
content: Rise in investments is an indication that the construction sector is getting back on track, says Siva Reddy

title: Chennai Metro Rail train chugs along from Porur to Vadapalani
content: The Chennai Metro Rail Limited conducted a trial run after the elevated viaduct from Porur to Vadapalani was completed. The section includes a 4-km double-decker line from  Alwarthirunagar to Alapakkam

title: Six years after law amended, Centre yet to constitute Arbitration Council of India
content: Senior officials in the Union Law Ministry said it took years for corporates and public sector undertakings to shun ad-hoc arbitration and go far institutional arbitration to settle commercial disputes

title: RSS evolving with time, taking new forms: Mohan Bhagwat
content: The RSS chief was addressing an event held at the organisation’s office here to launch the song album of the upcoming film Shatak, which chronicles the 100-year journey of the RSS

title: Trinamool’s campaign song for Assembly election plays up Bengali identity, language
content: The party’s three-minute, 13-second campaign song titled ‘Jotoi koro hamla, abar jitbe Bangla’ (attack as much you can, Bengal will win again)

title: Mehbooba Mufti takes exception to NSA Ajit Doval’s ‘revenge for history’ remark
content: Calling for revenge in the 21st century over centuries-old events is merely a dog whistle, inciting poor and uneducated youth to target a minority community, Ms. Mufti said.

title: Faster, demand-led approach needed for PSE privatisation: CII
content: In its proposals for the Union Budget 2026-27, the industry lobby calls for a rolling three-year pipeline, outlining which enterprises are likely to be taken up for privatisation during this period

title: Bhairav Battalions to make Army Day Parade debut in Jaipur on January 15
content: Two battalions of the special force will participate in this year’s parade—Southern Command’s 2 Bhairav Battalion, known as the ‘Desert Falcons’, and South Western Command’s 4 Bhairav Battalion

title: Indian Army officer from Bengaluru wins UN Secretary General’s Award 2025
content: Under her initiative and command, the team successfully conducted short- and long-distance patrols, integrated reverie patrols, and dynamic air patrols to far-flung counties of the host nation

title: Grok AI issue: X ‘accepts its mistake’, assures it will comply with Indian laws, say government sources
content: Around 3,500 pieces of content have been blocked, and over 600 accounts deleted, according to sources

title: WRD begins construction of 2 new check dams across Palar in Tirupattur
content: The ₹77.30-crore project will also involve repairs of two existing check dams across the river at Jafrabad and Kondai Oosi villages near Ambur town. The project is being funded by the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development

title: As German Chancellor Merz lands in Gujarat, activists demand that Modi ask for Ariha’s return
content: Officials say Ariha is meeting parents, Indian embassy in Germany regularly, no movement on government request that the five-year-old be brought up in Indian home

title: CM’s credibility eroded, says Gaurav Gogoi
content: Hitting out at Himanta Biswa Sarma, the State Congress president said Assam cannot continue to be divided by hatred and violence

title: YouTube channel booked for uploading misleading PU exam paper
content: The uploaded content allegedly mimicked the Hindi language preparatory examination paper for PU students scheduled to be held on January 9

title: 50,000 saplings to breathe new life into Nellore, says Narayana
content: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister says the massive plantation drive is aimed at developing Nellore Assembly constituency into a green lung space and enhancing overall urban greenery

title: Gandikota Festival off to a colourful start in Kadapa
content: Besides the historic fort, the ancient Madhavaraya temple, and the Jama Masjid, an helicopter ride offers visitors a breathtaking view of the gorge that is touted as India’s equivalent to the Grand Canyon in the U.S.

title: Our early primer for the divisional round matchups: How every team could win next weekend
content: Let's preview the divisional round matchups. How can each team win next weekend and advance? Here's what to know.

title: 49ers lose Kittle but carry his 'energy' to win
content: Despite another devastating injury to a team captain, the 49ers embodied the spirit of George Kittle to help will themselves to a playoff win over the Eagles.

title: Maye 'didn't throw very well,' pins win on defense
content: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye wasn't thrilled with his performance in Sunday's 16-3 wild-card victory over the Chargers. "Wasn't pretty, that's for sure," he said.

title: Sirianni defends Brown after drops, sideline spat
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni defended wide receiver A.J. Brown after a pair of drops in Sunday's loss to the Niners and also downplayed an animated interaction the two had in the opening half.

title: Herbert takes blame for Chargers' latest ouster
content: The Los Angeles Chargers' season ended Sunday with a loss to the New England Patriots, and Justin Herbert took responsibility for the poor performance, telling reporters after the 16-3 defeat, "I didn't play well enough and didn't make any plays."

title: QB Chambliss' eligibility fight heads to state court
content: Lawyers for Trinidad Chambliss plan to file suit against the NCAA in Mississippi state court this week for a preliminary injunction that will aim to secure the quarterback's eligibility for 2026.

title: Ant sinks winner to cap wild Wolves rally vs. Spurs
content: Anthony Edwards put the finishing touches on a wild, comeback win for Minnesota over San Antonio, a game they opened by trailing 16-0.

title: 'Warrior' Allen helps get Bills over hump on road
content: Fourth-quarter comebacks happen to be an important part of the team's success this season -- all behind quarterback Josh Allen -- and that continued Sunday as the reigning MVP led the Bills past the Jaguars in the AFC wild-card round 27-24.

title: Irish deny battery allegation against Freeman
content: Notre Dame has denied that Marcus Freeman made physical contact with anyone after the football coach was accused of battery in a police report filed Jan. 3.

title: 👀 Offseason guide for all eliminated NFL teams
content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 20 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: 'Not sure why they felt the need': NBA execs on the Trae deal and trade season's next move
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the Young deal and what comes next for the Wizards and Hawks.

title: Everything to know about the U.S. Olympic figure skating team
content: The U.S. Olympic figure skating team was named Sunday -- and could dominate at the Milan Cortina Olympics in less than a month.

title: JuJu Watkins makes history as Sierra Canyon's first jersey retirement
content: The USC standout became the first athlete in Sierra Canyon's history to receive the honor after a decorated three-year run.

title: How the Steelers forged Aaron Rodgers-Mike Tomlin connection
content: The bond between QB and coach has led Pittsburgh to its first home playoff game since the 2020 season.

title: 'Hungry for more': 49ers' petty posts at Eagles tops NFL wild-card trolls
content: The NFL wild-card round had its fair share of petty posts after big wins, led by the San Francisco 49ers.

title: With no manager, Manchester United continue to sink to new lows
content: In a season full of lows, Manchester United's early FA Cup exit only deepens their misery, denying them any chance of silverware this season.

title: WNBA, WNBPA fail to reach new CBA at deadline
content: The WNBA and its players' union failed to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement or an extension of the previous one by Friday's 11:59 p.m. ET deadline.

title: Solak: The Bears are a second-half team, and you can never count them out
content: Perhaps we shouldn't be surprised the Bears came back to beat the Packers. They've been doing this all season.

title: Ranking the best players in the college football transfer portal
content: the offseason transfer portal window for college football players opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2 . there's no spring transfer period this year, so teams have one big chance to get their rosters right for 2026 . here are ESPN's rankings of the top players in the portal .

title: How Lamar Jackson, Todd Monken, Ravens' locker room impacted Harbaugh's firing
content: it seems no one inside the Baltimore Ravens ' training facility had conviction that Tuesday would become the most shocking day in franchise history . the belief inside the building was that the Ravens would undergo staff changes, perhaps at the coordinator positions, but that Harbaugh would remain the head coach in 2026 .

title: Raphinha shines as Barça get thrilling win over Madrid in Supercopa final
content: lvaro Carreras and Ral Asencio spurned great late chances to take the game to a penalty shootout . barça beat real madrid 3-2 to retain the supercopa de Espaa in sao paulo .

title: MLB offseason grades: Cubs nab Bregman on five-year deal
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future or a blockbuster trade, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Ja Morant trade guide: Four proposals for Memphis -- if it can find a suitor
content: two-time All-Star point guard Ja Morant is averaging career lows in minutes, rebounds and 2- and 3-point percentages . he was suspended for one game earlier this season for conduct detrimental to the team . the 26-year-old has had multiple off-court issues and injuries .

title: Josh Allen, Bills outlast Jaguars to advance to AFC divisional round
content: the defense did its job to preserve a 27-24 loss to the Bills . quarterback Josh Allen tipped a Trevor Lawrence pass and safety Cole Bishop came away with the game-ending interception . the ball was in the hands of the team, just as the team would like .

title: College football buzz: What we're hearing about playoff expansion
content: a 16-team college football playoff format will begin as soon as 2026, sources say . there's still a stalemate between the two powerbrokers . the deadline for completing the format moved from Dec. 1 to Jan. 23, 2026 .

title: Niners defeat defending champs for NFC wild-card win
content: the 49ers won 12 games despite playing most of the season without defensive end and linebacker . they had withstood the repeated injuries to some of their brightest stars . despite that devastating injury to another team leader and captain, they continued to battle .

title: Drake Maye carries Patriots to wild-card win over Chargers
content: the new England Patriots beat the visiting Los Angeles Chargers 16-3 in the wild-card round of the AFC playoffs . the Patriots took advantage of the vulnerable offensive line, recording six sacks of quarterback Justin Herbert . this was the first game since Nov. 13 that the pats had three of their best players .
